result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Osborn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur. If after 2 yrs probation and has had no ATR's, no new charges rising to level of probable cause and pays court costs, can petition for early release of probation.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward CLG. Not use/possess alcohol.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268 paid in full from bond.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.
